applications

Class Library

  • java.lang.Object
    • applications.Library

  • public class Library
extends java.lang.Object

    Application exists to demonstrate how similar the applications how similar the applications are to real-world applications. It does this by Defining the statements INSERT and Select used in SQL.

    Version:
    1 -2014-04-10
    Author:
    Jose Ramirez

    • Constructor Detail

      • Library

        public Library()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init(java.lang.String[] args)
        Performs one-time intialization at start of application typically the following...

        processes the command-line arguments.

        opens input and/output files or database(s)

        opens network connections

        Parameters:
        args - arguments from command-line

      • insert

        public int insert(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        The contents of sb will be the line just read from the datascript. Picks up the data, removes all single quotes, creates an empty book and send the CSV created to the update(..) method of class Book, finally the new object is added to the database (Hashtable);

      • errorHtml

        public int errorHtml(java.lang.StringBuffer temp)
        This method is used to show an Error message when a book is not found on the Hashtable(database).

      • select

        public int select(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        The contents of sb will be the line just read from the datascript. Picks up the value and use it to extract the appropriate object from the Hashtable(database).

      • run

        public void run()
        Controls the major part of the application (typically in a loop which reads input file(s). This method controls the getting of the data, making a Book object and causes the contents of the object to be displayed and also shows all the methods applied on the object. Test will Run with NO command line arguments and NO keyboard input, only from datascripts by redirection.

      • usage

        private void usage()
        Displays a help message for how to use this application

      • wrap

        public int wrap()
        Performs one-time cleanup just before the application ends.

        closes input and/output files or database(s)

        closes network connections

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the first method called. It makes an object or its own class then calls methods init(), run() and wrap() in that sequence. Thus it clearly and completely controls the application (but the major work is delegated to be done in the init(), run() and wrap() methods).
